Issues.Title: fix(core): require 'static' flag on queries in typings
Issues.Body:
This commit makes the static flag on @ViewChild and @ContentChild required.

BREAKING CHANGE

Starting with v8.0, Angular requires that all @ViewChild and @ContentChild
queries have a 'static' flag specifying whether the query is 'static' or
'dynamic'. The compiler previously sorted queries automatically, but in
8.0 developers are required to explicitly specify which behavior is wanted.

@ViewChildren and @ContentChildren queries are always dynamic, and so are
unaffected.

See https://angular.io/guide/static-query-migration for more details (link not functional yet)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): require 'static' flag on queries in typings" (#30639)

Issues.Title: Bazel hangs loading the JDK
Issues.Body:
Across both of my machines lately, I've been seeing an issue where Bazel hangs at `currently loading: @local_jdk//`, or in the analysis phase. It spends O(minutes) here if it even completes at all, and CPU usage maxes out to the point where the machine becomes unusable otherwise. `bazel clean --expunge` solves the problem temporarily, but it will return without warning on future builds. 

```
$ bazel test //tools/public_api_guard/...
INFO: Invocation ID: f4f2d880-00c4-4ec6-8ef7-791019fcc2fa
INFO: Build option --legacy_external_runfiles has changed, discarding analysis cache.
Analyzing: 93 targets (4 packages loaded, 11414 targets configured)
    currently loading: @local_jdk//
```

This is making it difficult for me to work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bazel hangs loading the JDK" (#30636)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/common or @ngtools/webpack

### Description

I have 2 routes, one for the app module and one for the tabs module. 
#### App routes
```
const routes: Routes = [
  { path: '', redirectTo: 'home', pathMatch: 'full' },
  {
    path: 'home',
    loadChildren: './pages/home/home.module#HomePageModule'
  },
  { path: 'page/:pageName', loadChildren: './pages/page/page.module#PagePageModule' },

  {
    path: '',
    loadChildren: './tabs/tabs.module#TabsPageModule'
  }
]
```

#### App routes
```
const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: 'tabs',
    component: TabsPage,
    children: [
      {
        path: '',
        redirectTo: '/tabs/tabproduct',
        pathMatch: 'full'
      },
      {
        path: 'tabproduct',
        children: [
          {
            path: '',
            loadChildren: '../pages/tabproduct/tabproduct.module#TabproductPageModule'
          }
        ]
      },
      {
        path: 'tabstory',
        children: [
          {
            path: '',
            loadChildren: '../pages/tabstory/tabstory.module#TabstoryPageModule'
          }
        ]
      },
      {
        path: 'tab/:id',
        children: [
          {
            path: '',
            loadChildren: '../pages/tab/tab.module#TabPageModule'
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    path: '',
    redirectTo: '/tabs/tabproduct',
    pathMatch: 'full'
  }
]
```

On server side, I have a folder per version (v0.0, v0.1 ... v1.3 ...). I set up a default behavior in order to redirect on a version.
Ex: https://my.app.com/home -> returns the default version in the folder v1.3 for instance

So in my index.html, I have deleted the `<base href="/" />` tag and put a script instead :  
```
<script type='text/javascript'>
    let firstPathname = window.location.pathname.split('/')[1]
    console.log(firstPathname)

    let regexVersioningTag = new RegExp("^v");
    let result = regexVersioningTag.test(firstPathname);
    // if there is a version number
    if(result){ window['_app_base_href'] = '/' + firstPathname; }
</script>
```
So if there is an app version in the URL, the script stores it in a global variable.

In the app.module, I set the APP_BASE_HREF to the global variable or, by default, to '/' : 
```
@NgModule({
  declarations: [AppComponent],
  entryComponents: [],
  imports: [
    IonicModule.forRoot(),
    IonicStorageModule.forRoot(),
    AppRoutingModule,
  ],
  providers: [
    StatusBar,
    SplashScreen,
    { provide: RouteReuseStrategy, useClass: IonicRouteStrategy },
    { provide: APP_BASE_HREF, useValue: window['_app_base_href'] || '/' }
  ],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
  schemas: [NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA]
})
```


## üî¨ Issue

When I access to home page, it works like a charm ! (ie: https://my.app.com/home)

When I access to tabproduct page (ie: https://my.app.com/tabs.tabproduct), the browser produces errors because it's trying to get /tabs/{scripts.js} (but the page loads). 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38292202/58268988-d1c5c680-7d86-11e9-8219-6dc67e79e909.png)

However, the tags scripts in the index.html are good !
  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38292202/58268975-ca9eb880-7d86-11e9-8617-8d7b03fbabce.png)


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.8
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.5
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.5
@angular/cli                      7.3.5
@angular/compiler                 7.2.2
@angular/compiler-cli             7.2.8
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.8
webpack                           4.29.0

Issues.Title: test: reproduction for OnPush change detection difference with ivy
Issues.Body:
It looks like with View Engine it was possible to mark an on-push component as
dirty from within the `ngAfterViewInit` lifecycle hook, but now with Ivy the
component is set non-dirty as soon as the `ngAfterViewInit` hook finished. This
means that the `markForCheck` call in the lifycle hook is ignored/overwritten and
there is a different behavior in tests with Ivy (compared to view engine)

---

**Note**: This PR is not intended to be merged. It just serves as reproduction of an issue that can be easily reproduced within acceptance tests as there is the possibility of easily switching between Ivy and View Engine.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test: reproduction for OnPush change detection difference with ivy" (#30634)

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> #12411 and #17359 are still not solved, even though now the `canLoad` function possesses a `UrlSegment[]` argument. This argument enable us to access matrix parameters, but the query parameters and fragments of the destination url are still out of reach from inside of the `canLoad`function


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Instead of a `UrlSegment[]` argument, what we need is a `UrlTree`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> The only solutions available right now are still the same ones that have been given previously, and they are not satisfactory : either access the exact url from the `window` object (but there are lots of situation when the browser and router state are not in sync, like when using `skipLocationChange`) or give up on `canLoad` altogether and only use `canActivate` (but lose the benefit of lazyloading).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't access queryParams and fragments from canLoad" (#30633)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): don't throw on unmatched placeholder replacements in `i18nPostprocess`
Issues.Body:
Depending on which placeholders the translation uses, there are some legitimate cases where we might not use all placeholder replacements in `i18nPostprocess`. For example if some of the placeholders of the original messages have been removed in the translation.

FW-1312 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): don't throw on unmatched placeholder replacements in `i18nPostprocess`" (#30632)

Issues.Title: ng-add bazel enable fullTemplateTypeCheck by default and cannot be disabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/bazel` ### Is this a regression? no clue ### Description If a typical developer in his existing CLI project never mentioned option `angularCompilerOptions.fullTemplateTypeCheck` before and try to (ng-add) bazel in his project. Then run `ng serve` or `ng serve --prod` he will get **hundreds** or errors in his console and serving will fail due tue templates mistakes! **This candisrupt users and discourage them to try bazel!!!** ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction For repro you can clone [this existing CLI project](https://github.com/istiti/bazel-FullTemplateTypeCheck) that I ng-add bazel to it and make intentionally this error in [app.component.html](https://github.com/istiti/bazel-FullTemplateTypeCheck/blob/master/src/app/app.component.html#L5-L10) template To get error : `npm install && ng s` ## üî• Error All errors that `fullTemplateTypeCheck` can throw and fail to compile. Here I produce this error: 

/home/.../src/BUILD.bazel:15:1: Compiling Angular templates (ngc) //src:src failed (Exit 1)
.../app.component.html(10,7): : Property 'propNotExist' does not exist on type 'AppComponent'
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 8.0.0-rc.4
Node: 10.15.3
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.0.0-rc.4
... animations, bazel, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.800.0-rc.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.800.0-rc.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.800.0-rc.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.800.0-rc.4
@angular-devkit/core              8.0.0-rc.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.0.0-rc.4
@bazel/bazel                      0.25.1
@bazel/ibazel                     0.10.3
@bazel/karma                      0.27.12
@bazel/typescript                 0.27.12
@ngtools/webpack                  8.0.0-rc.4
@schematics/angular               8.0.0-rc.4
@schematics/update                0.800.0-rc.4
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.4.5
webpack                           4.30.0
**Anything else relevant?** Bazel always consider `fullTemplateTypeCheck` as enabled. It is important to note: even if we set to **FALSE** `angularCompilerOptions.fullTemplateTypeCheck` in `tsconfig.json` it is enabled. I think by default `fullTemplateTypeCheck` should be disabled like in CLI without bazel and let users enable it intentionally inside `tsconfig.json` cc @kyliau

Issues.Title: "Expression form not supported" when using static "this" with ternary operator
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not that I'm aware of. ### Description Compilation fails when using `this` with the ternary operator in a static method. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. ng new cli-test 2. cd cli-test 3. ng g library test-lib 4. Issues.Title: fileReplacements causes duplication of code
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not that I'm aware of ### Description If you use fileReplacements to replace one file with a file that already exists, then the file will be effectively imported twice. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Highcharts has multiple versions. There's the base highcharts.js but then there's also highstock.js and highcharts-more.js. All versions include the original base highcharts. We have libraries that just need the base highcharts version. However, some apps need more functionality so they import one of the other versions. We don't need both the base highcharts and say, highstock. The assumption was that we could use fileReplacements to say "whenever you find highcharts, use highstock instead". Like: ``` { "replace": "./node_modules/highcharts/highcharts.js", "with": "./node_modules/highcharts/highstock.js" } ``` This actually made our bundle size bigger (which was obviously the opposite of the desired effect). Upon investigating, I found that fileReplacements was replacing highcharts with highstock and ignoring the fact that highstock already existed. So now we had 2 copies of highstock. ## üî• Exception or Error N/A ## üåç Your Environment

Node: 10.15.2

Issues.Title: Differentiate lib build from app build in reference doc
Issues.Body:
Explain that `ng build` command invokes different builders for apps and libs, and that only two options apply to libs.

This is a stop-gap doc fix - it points out that `ng build app-project` uses a different builder than `ng build lib-project`, and that most options doc'd here apply only to apps. This can keep readers from trying to apply options to libs, but we really need a separate doc page for the lib builder.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Differentiate lib build from app build in reference doc" (#14508)

Issues.Title: Building package with wrap-enums build optimizer gets stuck
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] build ``` ### Is this a regression? No idea. ### Description Building a project with [messageformat](https://messageformat.github.io/messageformat/) 2.2.1 or later as a dependency, either directly or via [ngx-translate-messageformat-compiler](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ngx-translate-messageformat-compiler), gets stuck if `buildOptimizer` is true. Hacking `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-optimizer/src/build-optimizer/build-optimizer.js` (version 0.13.9) to comment out [line 110 (js) / 155 (ts)](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/f651a2bd30fe812954dee6cc1fb2cc2e385a1bfd/packages/angular_devkit/build_optimizer/src/build-optimizer/build-optimizer.ts#L155) allows for the build to succeed, and would suggest that the issue is caused by the wrap-enums transform. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```sh git clone git@github.com:frankie567/messageformat-issue-239.git cd messageformat-issue-239 npm install npm run build -- --prod # gets stuck sed -ie '110d' node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-optimizer/src/build-optimizer/build-optimizer.js npm run build -- --prod # succeeds ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Pass extra terser options through the angular.json
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description

Right now I can't just add these extra terser options to a custom webpack config and expect it to work because the "bundleOptimizer: true" option would just overwrite the whole thing. (Given the nature of the config I'm not expecting that this would be possible anytime, hence this proposal:) If I'd to disable that, I'd need to re-implement the whole thing just to change one option. And when I do it naively with a simple setup it straight up fails. (Probably because ng8 now builds both legacy and modern bundles and would require different setups, as I've seen that in this repo where the default config is assembled. But I have no way differentiating that in a custom config file.)

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add a terserOptions config option -- which accepts an object -- into the project's angular.json config (under architect.build.configurations.production). And merge it into the default terserOptions object if exists. (This one here: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/74f2ee68d6d166903d5ef571d8a793bd4994e142/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/common.ts#L284)

### Use-case

I'd like to have the terser option "keep_classnames" turned on (set to a set of classes which are to be persisted) because of a serialization/deserialization mechanic that resolves the class that belongs to a JSON (stored in a database) by the name of the class. If the name of the class is minified,  these persistent, serialized objects would not be cross-compatible between dev and prod builds. Also there's no guarantee that between different prod versions these minified class names wouldn't change over time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pass extra terser options through the angular.json" (#14487)

Issues.Title: test: fix flaky slide-toggle test with pending timer task
Issues.Body:
One of the slide-toggle tests has become quite flaky the
last days and after debugging ZoneJS it turns out that
this is related to the `(focus)` event from the `FocusMonitor`
and we can safely improve the stability of the test by removing
the `fakeAsync` which isn't needed anyway.

For reference: Other tests asserting the `click` event on
the slide-toggle native element also have a `tick()`
specified but we don't need to wait for pending timers
anyway.. so we can just remove `fakeAsync .
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: fix flaky slide-toggle test with pending timer task" (#16102)

Issues.Title: [MatRipple] Hover/Touch Event listeners are still added when ripples are disabled via a MAT_RIPPLE_GLOBAL_OPTIONS Provider
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-asjy3a

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a provider for MAT_RIPPLE_GLOBAL_OPTIONS that disabled ripples, e.g.
```
@Injectable({providedIn: 'root'})
export class AppGlobalRippleOptions implements RippleGlobalOptions {
  disabled: boolean = true;
}
```
2. Include a Material Component that uses MatRipple, but doesn't disable them via the component input (e.g. MatButton).
 
#### Expected Behavior

When Ripples are globally disabled, elements containing a MatRipple should not have event listeners attached to the target elements.

#### Actual Behavior

Even when Ripples are globally disabled via a MAT_RIPPLE_GLOBAL_OPTIONS Provider, elements with MatRipples will have six click/touch listeners attached. These listeners are not themselves problematic, but when many components are present on the page represent a significant performance hit.

It looks like the last work done on this was in #11865. I discovered this issue when trying to enable and disable ripples at runtime as described in the [documentation](https://material.angular.io/components/ripple/overview#updating-global-options-at-runtime) (as a means to further improve initial page load performance (a surprising amount of time is consumed setting up these 6 event listeners per element).

#### Environment

- Angular: 7.2.3
- CDK/Material: 7.3.0
- Browser(s): n/a (All)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): n/a (All)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[MatRipple] Hover/Touch Event listeners are still added when ripples are disabled via a MAT_RIPPLE_GLOBAL_OPTIONS Provider" (#16100)

Issues.Title: AriaDescriber should let us describe elements via other DOM Elements (as well as just string)
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

First, i believe this API should be public: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/a11y/aria-describer/aria-describer.ts#L70

Second, it can be improved to support describing hostElement (first parameter) via already existing DOM node (instead of just message).

So maybe the new API could look like:

`describe(hostElement: Element, message: string|Element)`

instead of

`describe(hostElement: Element, message: string)`

#### Use Case

In GCP (Google Cloud Platform), we have tried to use this API per @jelbourn recommendation. But we were unable to use it easily because we wanted to provide HTMLElement to the describe function (not a string)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AriaDescriber should let us describe elements via other DOM Elements (as well as just string)" (#16099)

Issues.Title: schematic(nav): Async pipes should not be negated
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Running a schematic will not result in a lint failure.

#### What is the current behavior?
Running the `nav` schematic results in this failure:
```js
ERROR: nav.component.html:5:16 - Async pipes should not be negated. Use (observable | async) === (false | null | undefined) to check its value instead
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. `ng g @angular/material:nav nav`

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```js
    "@angular/animations": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/cdk": "~8.0.0-rc.1",
    "@angular/common": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/compiler": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/core": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/forms": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/material": "^8.0.0-rc.1",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/router": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "hammerjs": "^2.0.8",
```
Plus `codelyzer@5.0.1`
OS: macOS Mojave

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This appears to be related to the following tslint rule:
```js
"template-no-negated-async": true,
```
Which is documented [here](http://codelyzer.com/rules/templates-no-negated-async/).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "schematic(nav): Async pipes should not be negated" (#16085)

Issues.Title: build: add linting for bazel build files
Issues.Body:
It was always painful to create/update Bazel build files as there were
no real rules for formatting. In order to not bother too much about
formatting and having consistent `BUILD.bazel` /`.bzl` files, `buildifier`
is now running as a CI check to lint these files.

**Note**: Setup is consistent with what we have on `angular/angular`. We want to keep the buildifier logic inside of the npm scripts as we don't want to add a dependency on bash for developers. Buildifier doesn't support configuration files for the warnings.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: add linting for bazel build files" (#16090)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk-experimental/testing): Bring in component harness
Issues.Body:
This is the initial PR bringing in the the `ComponentHarness` from google3. Huge thanks to @qiyigg and @vikerman for getting this started, and to all who contributed to the code in google3.

## Main files
* `cdk-experimental/testing/component-harness.ts` contains classes and interfaces that define the test-environment-independent component harness
  * `ComponentHarness` the base class for all harnesses
  * `TestElement` an interface used by the `ComponentHarness` to interface with the DOM
  * `Locator` an interface used by the `ComponentHarness` to find `TestElement`s

* `cdk-experimental/testing/testbed.ts` contains implementation specific to Angular's `TestBed`
  * `TestBed` compatible implementations of `TestElement` and `Locator`
  * `load` method used to create instances of `ComponentHarness` that are compatible with `TestBed`
  * Depends on `@angular/core/testing`

* `cdk-experimental/testing/protractor.ts` contains implementation specific to Protractor.
  * Protractor compatible implementations of `TestElement` and `Locator`
  * `load` method used to create instances of `ComponentHarness` that are compatible with `TestBed`
  * Depends on `protractor` and `selenium-webdriver`

* `cdk-experimental/testing/test-app/*` a simple app that exists to serve as a testing ground to run e2e and unit tests that use `ComponentHarness`

## Questions
* Is it ok that `testbed.ts` and `protractor.ts` live inside `cdk-experimental` but have dependencies on `@angular/core/testing` and `protractor` respectively? We obviously don't want `cdk` to have a dependency on `protractor` in the future.
  * Option 1: Leave everything in `cdk-experimental` and just don't add `protractor` to `package.json`
  * Option 2: Move all of the cdk testing stuff to its own package
  * Option 3: Move just the environment files (`testbed.ts`, `protractor.ts`) to some other package

* How should the tests of the harness code itself be structured? It's weird to have the test-app nested under `cdk-experimental/testing` but its nice to have the tests themselves (`testbed.spec.ts`, `protractor.e2e.spec.ts`) co-located with the code.

## Future work
* Have the harness know it's component's root selector
* Add convenience method for checking CSS classes
* Fix protractor implementation of `focs`/`blur`
* Add ability for testbed implementation to detect `fakeAsync` tests
* Refactor names and structure of some of the objects (e.g. `load`)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " feat(cdk-experimental/testing): Bring in component harness" (#16089)

Issues.Title: schematics(tree): Expected property shorthand in object literal
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Running a schematic will not result in a lint failure.

#### What is the current behavior?
Running the `tree` schematic results in this failure:
```js
ERROR: tree.component.ts:58:7 - Expected property shorthand in object literal ('{level}').
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. `ng g @angular/material:tree tree`

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```js
    "@angular/animations": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/cdk": "~8.0.0-rc.1",
    "@angular/common": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/compiler": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/core": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/forms": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/material": "^8.0.0-rc.1",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "@angular/router": "~8.0.0-rc.4",
    "hammerjs": "^2.0.8",
```
Plus `codelyzer@5.0.1`
OS: macOS Mojave

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The quick fix seems to change this:
```ts
    return {
      name: node.name,
      type: node.type,
      level: level,
      expandable: !!node.children
    };
```
to this:
```ts
    return {
      name: node.name,
      type: node.type,
      level,
      expandable: !!node.children
    };
```
This appears to be related to the [`object-literal-shorthand`](https://palantir.github.io/tslint/rules/object-literal-shorthand/) rule that is pulled in as part of `"extends": "tslint:recommended",`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "schematics(tree): Expected property shorthand in object literal" (#16086)

Issues.Title: perf(drag-drop): use narrower check for touch events
Issues.Body: We use the `isTouchEvent` any time we need to normalize something between touch and mouse events which happens for every pixel that the user has dragged. These changes switch to using direct comparison, rather than `startsWith`, which should be slightly faster since there's a narrow set of touch event types.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(drag-drop): use narrower check for touch events" (#16082)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): error if drag sequence is started while another one is finishing
Issues.Body:
Fixes an error being thrown if the user manages to start a different drag sequence while the previous one is finishing. The error comes from the fact that some elements are still being moved around while we're waiting for the previous animation to finish.

Fixes #13077.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): error if drag sequence is started while another one is finishing" (#16081)

Issues.Title: Revert "refactor: mark injectable refs with `@Injectable`"
Issues.Body:
Reverts angular/components#15584

Issues.Title: [Docs] Tests with MatButton failing after migration to v8 RC1
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Document in changelog about [moving disabled input form props to attributes](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/15308) as it may impact unit tests.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

While upgrading material from v7 => v8 RC1 everything worked but few unit tests started to fail where disabled property was probed on material buttons.

It was tested via Angular's `DebugElement.properties.disabled` API and since mat-button now set's it as attribute that is no longer the case and it's now in `DebugElement.attributes.disabled`.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

From the final functional perspective this may be not a breaking change since disabled property and attribute are synchronised but while testing via `DebugElement` API this will impact test cases.

So it will be good idea to note this in the changelog.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Docs] Tests with MatButton failing after migration to v8 RC1" (#16078)
